title: Meet the baby girl born to Chinese pensioner, 67, who 'conceived naturally'
text:
This is the first footage of a baby girl born to a 67-year-old pensioner who claimed to have conceived naturally.

The child's mother is reported to be a retired Chinese doctor, Tian, who is recovering 'very well' after a Caesarean section.

If Tian's claim proves to be true, she could be the world's oldest natural mother, beating the last record holder by nearly 10 years in age.

The baby's father has released footage of the girl struggling to stay awake after she was born by Caesarean section on Friday. The child's mother, 67, claims she conceived naturally

The mother, a retired doctor, is pictured recovering in hospital in Zaozhuang after surgery

The father, a 68-year-old retired lawyer, said the baby was feeding on his wife's breast milk

Tian told Chinese media her pregnancy was an accident. She said she had experienced bleeding and initially thought she was ill.

The pensioner said she only discovered she was pregnant when she went to hospital for a health check, according to Jinan Times.

She told the newspaper: 'I didn't want it, initially.'

The hospital said it could not confirm that Tian had conceived naturally because she was already pregnant when it took her as a patient.

Tian's daughter was born on Friday in the Chinese city of Zaozhuang in eastern China.

She weighed 2,560 grams (5.6 pounds) at birth. The couple have named their child 'Tianci', meaning 'gift from heaven'.

A midwife hands the father, Huang, his newborn daughter in Zaozhuang city's Maternity and Child Health Care Hospital, eastern China, after the girl was delivered by Caesarean section

Tian is seen being pushed out of the operating theatre after giving birth to a 5.6lb healthy girl on Friday. She may be the world's oldest natural mother if her claim proves to be true

WHAT ARE THE HEALTH RISKS OF A LATE PREGNANCY? Greater difficulty in initially conceiving a child, with the personal and psychological difficulties that this can cause.

Increased risk of complications for both mother and infant during pregnancy and delivery (although the actual size of the risk may be small).

Greater risk of general maternal health problems, such as high blood pressure, which can contribute to complications.

Higher risk of miscarriage in women above the age of 35.

Higher risk of having twins or triplets, which is itself associated with higher risk of complications.

Increased chance of having a baby with a congenital abnormality, such as Down's syndrome.

Increased risk of pre-eclampsia.

Increased risk of complications during delivery, such as prolonged labour, need for assisted delivery or Caesarean section, or stillbirth. Source: NHS

The baby's father, 68-year-old Huang, described his newborn daughter as 'obedient'.

The retired lawyer said his wife was breastfeeding the child and he had hired a caretaker to look after the two.

The proud father-of-three showed the video of the girl struggling to stay awake to Chinese video news site Pear.

He also called the newborn 'a gift from heaven' and promised to protect her.

Tian and her daughter left hospital to go home yesterday, reported local news site Qilu Net.

To bring good luck to his daughter, Huang wrapped her in a red blanket according to local customs.

He also put peanuts, dates and branches of a peach tree on the girl to wish for plenty of offspring for her.

Huang could not hide his joy when he picked up his wife and child from Zaozhuang city's Maternity and Child Health Care Hospital.

With a big smile on his face, the man told a reporter: '[I am] very happy.'

He said his wife could walk without a problem and had plenty of breast milk.

While Huang and Tian believe they are China's oldest couple to conceive naturally, Tian's advanced age means she could have broken a world record.

Huang wraps his daughter in a red blanket and puts branches of a peach tree on the child according to local customs when he picks up the baby and his wife from hospital yesterday

Currently, the world's oldest woman to conceive naturally is retired civil servant Dawn Brooke from Guernsey, who fell pregnant at the age of 58.

She initially feared that her aches, cravings and exhaustion were signs of cancer.

Mrs Brooke gave birth to a son by C-section in 1997.

The world's oldest mother, on the other hand, is thought to be 74-year-old Erramatti Mangayamma from India, who last month gave birth to a pair of twin girls after undergoing IVF.

Dawn Brooke (pictured), from Guernsey, is currently the world's oldest woman to have given birth after conceiving naturally at the age of 58. She delivered her son by C-section in 1997

The Chinese couple already had two children before 'Tianci', including a son born in 1977, two years before China imposed a one-child policy to control its burgeoning population.

Reports of the birth in China have drew criticism on the country's Twitter-like platform Weibo.

'The parents are too selfish,' one person wrote. 'At their advanced age they have no ability to take care of a kid, and the pressure will be on the older siblings.'

'Poor child, she's going to start taking care of her elderly parents by the time she's 20,' wrote another.

Huang (right) checks on his wife Tian after she delivered their third child at the age of 67

Huang, a proud father, holds up a commemorative birth certificate gifted by the hospital

Others wondered if Tian and Huang would be penalised for having more than the current allowance of two children.

In response to criticism, Huang said he and his wife had their plans for the child.

'I know they (web users) have said something [about us]. I wish to tell them not to interfere in the privacy of my family, especially that of my children,' Huang said.

'The child has been born. She is a gift from heaven. We will protect her,' he added.
description: This is the first footage of a baby girl born to a 67-year-old retired doctor who claimed to have conceived naturally. The child was delivered on Friday via Caesarean section in Zaozhuang city, China.
